title: Test
yAxis: Total damage in million U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Total damage in million U.S. dollars, with a total of 17 data points.
Overall Total damage in million U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.

Total damage in million U.S. dollars is rapidly increasing from 2001 to 2005, roughly constant from 2005 to 2008, roughly increasing from 2008 to 2009, roughly constant from 2009 to 2017, and lastly roughly increasing from 2017 to 2018.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2017 and 2018.
Max Total damage in million U.S. dollars about 2710.0 was recorded at Year 2018
Min Total damage in million U.S. dollars about 17.8 was recorded at Year 2001
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Total damage in million U.S. dollars, with a total of 17 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2004 to 2011.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2011 to 2016.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2001 to 2004.
Also, the next significant trend is extremely decreasing which exists from 2016 to 2018.
